subject: Re: My first session with Joe's Box
author: Steve Hultay
full_text:
Ursula,

Great files, i'm glad to see you are getting results right away.  If 
you need anything just let me know and i'll help the best i can.  It 
sure seems like you are doing just fine on your own though.  Keep up 
the good work and i look forward to future posts.  Joe's box is 
definetely different than other boxes out there, i know i've used 
them all.  It's not as smooth running, but the answers are very loud 
and direct.

-Steve H.





--- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, "lalarutabaga" <ursulabielski@...> 
wrote:
>
> Received and held my first session with Joe's Box yesterday, and 
> thought it might be good to see what you guys think of what I got. 
I 
> will upload them in a minute under Ursula- Joe's Box. 
> 
> The two clips are actually from the second session, which I did 
about 
> five minutes after the first, uneventful one.
> 
> Both clips are from the same session.
> 
> The first clip is from the beginnng of the four-minute session.  I 
> have just asked, "Is there something you want to say?" and then 
> before and while I repeat the question, a voice says, "-the fuck 
up.  
> Shut the--"
> 
> The second clip happens later.  I had asked "What is my name?" and 
> the earlier ("shutthefuckup") smart-alecky voice had 
answered "Ursula 
> Anne" in a singsong way (This is a little weird because my real 
name 
> is Anne Ursula, so kids used to tease me by calling me Ursula Anne 
at 
> school after I started going by my middle name at age 11.) 
> 
> The second clip starts immediately after, when the same voice 
> says, "Zip It!"
> Then, a second voice says, "Shhh. Listen, you'll scare her." 
> Then the first voice says, "Aww!"  Then something I can't make out 
in 
> short bursts.
> Then, I say "I'm listening" because I heard "Listen" from the 
second 
> voice.
> After my voice you hear "Here you go!" and then "What's Up?!" from 
> that second voice again.
> 
> I'm full of wonder about this box.  It was odd. People say the 
boxes 
> FEEL different from anything else, and I really did.  I KNEW 
somehow 
> when I started that second session that there would be something, 
and 
> it was like the language opened itself up to me.  It's a very 
> different sounding sort of thing from anything else.  I can't 
really 
> describe it.  It's much, much different from anything I've done 
> before and quite Awe-some in a literal sense.
> 
> I was also very surprised that I wasn't at all afraid of whatever 
> idiot was swearing and saying stupid things.  Like a bully on a 
> playground, really.  Nothing scarier than that.  
> 
> Thanks, Steve, for giving me the chance to experience this tool.  
And 
> thanks, Frank, dear Frank who I've never met, for having the box 
idea 
> in the first place.
> 
> Ursula
>
